column4: a friend gave me a computer -- installs of windows xp and ubuntu won't boot -- system rescue cd will find ubuntu and boot it, but ubuntu won't boot off the disk -- i've tried fixmbr and fixboot for windows w/ no success -- is it time to trash the disk?
you could check the drive under ubuntu live CD using Disk Utility
disk utility says the disk is ok
then it must be okay, format it in Disk Utility
and assign a new partition table
but remember to format the drive, not the partition
i let ubuntu have the entire drive when doing the install -- most of the drive was one partition, with also a partition for swap and one more i think
and you installed grub on /dev/sda ?
didn't install grub as a separate activity -- it's not been necessary for any installs that i have done before
then it installed itself automatically, and what, it didn't boot after that?
it won't boot -- all i get is a blinking cursor
at which point, since the beginning of the bootup process? Is BIOS set to boot off of this drive?
i've had it as the top -- also below the CD and used bios to select the hard drive when i wanted to test so i know that i'm trying to boot from the disk
i've booted system rescue cd and tried 2 options: 1) find a linux system and boot it; 2) boot from the hard disk ---- #1 works and #2 doesn't
linux will be read from the CD into the RAM, so it will work
is it a laptop?
try manually disconnecting the drive and connecting it back
this is a dell desktop -- i thought it would be a nice sandbox
i'll also ready over the suggestions on the thread that the bot sent - thanks for your help
I remember I had problems like that once but that was because of bad sectors. I could only use the drive for storage.
sorry I couldn't resolve it
